Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on a good location”
Reviews.Author: Moher
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is in a good location in Berlin and very near to public transport to get yo uarround. The hotel is clean and the rooms are nice. The public area's are a bit poor i.e. the bar area and restaurant are not very atractive to stay however arround the hotel are plenty of alternatives so that do's not have to be a problem. What is a bit of a problem is that he hotel has ONLY ONE elivator and in themorning that is a bit of a pain if you need to get down from the 7th floor with your luggage. As for the rooms as k for a room at the back as the rooms in hte frond can be a bit noisy form passing trains. Last but not least the hotel has no airco so it might get a bit warm in the summer

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bhargava-Anshul
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on Alexandra Platz and close the the tram station. basic Service with courteous service is lacking... i hope they improve. was staying in 114 and every time we opened the room there was a smell reported to front desk, i stayed for 4 days and the smell did not go.

Reviews.Title: “Far out, but often economical”
Reviews.Author: Maitland55
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is far out in the East, with a view to visitors mainly dealing with the old West or with the administrative centre. If you do not speak German and are not familiar with the city, you should first check with the maps and find out about the location. It appears to me that this property "fills up" later than other Holiday Inns in Berlin and rates are economical even at the time when some West Berlin properties are full. The new airport may change the situation though, from June 2012. In terms of public tranist, the hotel underlines that it is just one tram ride from the City East. But for further connections, change of tranist mode is usually necessary. The surrounding area is typical East German housing construction, "Platbauten", overhauled for the contemporary demand. The main door of the hotel is at the rear side. For a late evening arrival the situation may be baffling. There is an entrance on the main street side as well, but it seemed to be closed part of the day. Street lighting is not quite adeaquate and some concern may be felt..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: curban17
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is a bit hard to find, but taking a taxi to the front door made life easier. Rooms were very clean and the food in the restaurant was very good. Everything you need is right at the hotel. Very friendly staff. Would defitely stay here again if we ever get back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrjayjay
Reviews.Content: my only moan was that they don't do double beds, instead you have to join two singles together? other than this, room was good. bathroom and shower were nice. hotel food (breakfast) was very good and staff all spoke English and were very helpful. in terms of location, its about a 10 min tram ride into the city center and about 20 min ride to the airport. I quite liked the location and it wouldn't put me off staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Back in the DDR - 2011 edition”
Reviews.Author: FreeMind
Reviews.Content: I don't know what I had taken to have chosen this hotel for a one night stay in Berlin. Not that there is anything wrong with the hotel, but, the location is a bit remote if you want to explore the inner city. If you are interested in history, do not forget to visit The Weissensee Jewish Cemetery and Gedenkstätte Berlin- Hohenschönhausen (the Stasi museum). Both at a walking distance. Luckily, there are tram stops all around the hotel, too. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, the business class room was nice too. Nothing new and modern, but clean and comfortable. My photos tell more than 1000 words.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coltswood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week for my first visit to Berlin. Check in and check out both quick and easy. Check in staff were very pleasant and extremely informative; giving me a map and pointing out places to go. I was offered a choice of rooms on different floors which was nice. When I got to the room was surprised how big it was. The only negative thing about the room was no tea and coffee making facilities. However there was a self service cold drinks dispenser on every second floor which even stocked beer. When I required an iron and ironing board I phoned housekeeping and requested this using my rudimentary German. The housekeeper delivered my request very quickly and then spoke to me in perfect English: that probably speaks volumes about how bad my German was! I didn't use the restaurant but ate elsewhere in Berlin. The only downside of the hotel was its location, requiring a short tram ride to the nearest U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations but I knew about this before I booked. The trams were very regular which made the experience very easy. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice”
Reviews.Author: kingtravel1
Reviews.Content: Bit too far out of town but was clean/nice and staff were helpful!

Reviews.Title: “standard holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: aleksandarBeograd
Reviews.Content: always looking for renovated superior rooms(spacios,clean, confortable) friendly helpful staff,good buffet breakfast,free parking location-about 20 minutes by tram to the city centre no coffe maker(only executive club rooms)no pool.no free wifi, the price was reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: livelife87
Reviews.Content: We went on a grouptour and Holiday Inn Berlin City East was our Hotel. I was sceptical because I read reviews all over the internet.... but i was very pleased. Nice and very CLEAN!!!! rooms. Walking to the city is kinda farr. But since we are not afraid of catching a tram/train we just took the tram when we didn't ride with the tourbus. There's 2 trams that stop near the hotel (5 min walk to tram sto) Breakfast was good althought the same everyday and as I've read... cold coffee, milk and choco.milk. But I think you can ask them to warm it up, tea was hot thoug :-). I didn't like the single beds pushed together to a twin bed but besides that no complaints. I think most European hotels have that standard. Not allot to see on tv and no i'net (unles you pay) but we were mostly outside traveling. And we didn't have any problems in regards to noise. Good price for a good hotel! You get what u pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for business in hotel, but nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: penguin3
Reviews.Content: Although hotel has good access to tram lines and buses which will take you to the city center, the hotel is far away from everything. 45 minutes by taxi from Tegel Airport. It is used by big bus tours so mornings and evenings are very busy. Hotel staff friendly, helpful. Rooms adequate, housekeeping adequate. Restaurants have very limited menu, almost nothing for vegetarians. Breakfast buffet very good, but layout of room makes it difficult to access buffet line. Impossibly small area for large tour groups and staff inadequate to deal with turnover of tables. All restaurant service very slow, even when there are only a few people dining. No amenities, for example no mini-bar in room, no coffee maker, almost non-existant toiletries, no swimming pool, health club etc. Rooms noisy, both from traffic outside hotel and from hotel doors slamming shut in corridor. Would only go back for business meetings Otherwise look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A "Good bye Lenin" atmosphere we loved”
Reviews.Author: FouineLapin
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for many reasons. 1st, its price. We booked early and paid 120 Euros for three nights. We were not expecting much for that price but instead we got a priceless travel back in time. The hotel is nowhere near any usual tourists’ landmarks but being located in the middle of a working class area of former East Berlin it gave us the opportunity to grasp a feel of how it might have look before reunification. Apart from big international corporations’ billboards, the area appears very much like on DDR “ideal workers cities” pictures. We’re not sure whether ideal and concrete boxes go well together but for three days our massive concrete box hotel offered us a spacious, comfortable and clean room where we slept tight. Despite an effort to mask the hotel recent past with a coat of paint, in our standard room, a few details like the shower curtain, anti-slip mat, toilet pan, etc., were bearing the vintage East Germany fashion hallmarks, and we liked that. We had the choice of a smoking or non-smoking room, which is becoming a rarity these days, and it feels good not to be treated like Pariahs sometimes. There’s also a free parking and best of all, the staff at reception, despite sometimes not having a clue, were very friendly and welcoming. Finally, although the hotel isn’t in a tourist area there are three tram lines stopping a few steps away from it and taking you to the city centre in about 20 minutes. You can buy tickets at reception, and if you have the time, use the three lines to get a glimpse of different areas but make sure you take a walk in the vicinity of the hotel. It doesn’t look pretty in a conventional sense but you will find some bargain priced and unusual souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Favourable stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JeppeLo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed in the Lichtenberg-district og Berlin. Not particular central, but it's very simple to reach the districts of Mitte, Friedrichshain and Kreuzberg with the tram. The price was just unbelievable: 120 Euro for 3 nights in a twin-bedded room. The room was big and clean, and we had a beautiful view over the city. The staff was helpful and overall quite friendly. Only the price of 5 Euro for 1 hour internet was a bad thing about staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aleeshabeevi
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my colleagues for two days. the rooms are spacious and well equipped. there are shopping malls closeby. few minutes walk takes one to the tram stop from where one can take a tram no 5 and 6 to alexander plaza which is the happening place. there are malls and shops and entertainment etc. the city tour buses also start from there. one can buy a 10 euro ticket if one buys the ticket there but we bought the ticket at hotel which was by a different operator which cost us 20 euros. the hotel is always filled with busloads of tourists which is slightly irritating for business travellers. The hotel restaurant was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Julioromero2000
Reviews.Content: We love this place, the only disadvantage is the transportation to downtown. Getting around the city in metro is a little too hard and the distance to places where you can get tickets are not so close. Other than that, the hotel is awesome, and the breakfast are glorious. Computers with internet are available, but only two for a hotel of more that 200 rooms; so time is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Raffi1946
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that this hotel hosts many groups. It might be crowded during meals but the dinning room staff is very efficient and polite. Meals were very good with a wide selection of food. If you choose to stay here, you should come eigher with a car or with an organized tour because the hotel is quite far from the center of Berlin. Public efficient transportation is very nearby. The hotel is very modern with nice spacious rooms. Pity they don't include refrigerator and tee / coffee set. Housekeeping could be better - one small piece of soap for the whole 6 days. In general, we enjoined our stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressive”
Reviews.Author: pixie088
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception were not too friendly or welcoming, however staff at the restaurant were excellent. It is definitely not a 4 star hotel as someone else mentioned, the room I was in was very outdated with grubby carpet. Breakfast was ok, probably not worth it unless it is already included in the price. The location is very far out of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, No Sleep”
Reviews.Author: pradipd25
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to forgo sleep for good value, then stay at this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights and could not get a good night sleep even one night. The beds are lousy. They sink almost into the floor. The mattresses are totally sagging. I asked for a different room and was told that all beds are the same. Ina ddition, in most hotels in Europe, there is no concept of ONE double or queen or king bed. There are 2 singlke beds put together with separate mattresses and duvets. Is this how couples sleep in Europe? Except for this minor detail of no sleep, the hotel provides good value in a very expensive city. The location seems a bit away, but is only a 5 minute walk to the tram and a 15 minute ride into Alexanderplatz. However forget about breakfast. It is a ripoff at 13 euros per person specially if you do not eat dead animals or unborn birds. But then there is no other choice around the hotel. So the hotel has got you captive. The breakfast for 2 of us worked out to just over half our room rate! Proportionate to room rate, I have NEVER paid so much for breakfast in any hotel in the world. Also,keep in mind that because of the value provided by the hotel and ample parking, the hotel is chockfull of bus loads of groups and tourists. Also, if you are a Platinum member as I am, do not expect any benefits. There are none. I did have included internet, but that is because I had booked a business room.

Reviews.Title: “All together, it was a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: SmooveG
Reviews.Content: Coming to Berlin, first time in this hotel. Upon arrival check in went without any problems. I had booked a business room because the WIFI is included in the package. The woman behind the counter was friendly and very clear with the explanations. When I entered the room, all seemed to be in order. Nothing missing, broken or non functional. Room as well as the bedroom looked clean enough so no complaints there either. I noticed that every time I passed a person on dutie inside the hotel, there was always a friendly good..something. A positive thing as I must say. In the morning breakfast was served in buffet style on the ground floor from 6am to 10:30am. The way it was presented was pleasant to see. Only, where was the coffee? Probably inside the white thermos can in the middle of the table but who knows for how long it had been standing there. Also missed the eggs service, I've seen some hard boiled ones and scrambled passing along the buffet. So that had to do for that day. Besides that everything was in order during my stay. One advise though, don't pay extra for booking the business room because of the free WIFI. It only allows you to log in with one single device only. So if you connect with your smart phone, you can forget about using your laptop or any other device after that. It probably connects the log in data to your devices MAC address. Went to the reception since I needed internet access on my laptop. I was surprised they couldn't help me out, very disappointing. I would have generated another user/password and problem would have been solved, but hey, that's just me. I would go there again, but only if I was sure not to have to work on the internet during my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in East Berlin - Close to transport”
Reviews.Author: TimandKath
Reviews.Content: The hotel has free parking behind, which is good. The lobby looks nice and is very inviting. Room (801) is huge, 2 single beds pushed together but comfortable to lay on. There were 5 different types of pillows available upon request. Hotel and surroundings information is in the room. There are 2 spaces for your suitcase to rest on. Bathroom is modern and clean and has good water pressure. Heating is good in bathroom. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. They gave us a map and showed us the tram stops. There is no in-room safe but safes are available at reception for no extra cost. A little far from the city centre, but catching the tram is very easy and the stop is only a few minutes walk away. Tram to Alexanderplatz is about 15 minutes. No included breakfast, but available at €18 per person. No mini-bar or fridge in room. Vending machine on a few floors which has well priced drinks/snacks (including alcohol). Room decor is fresh and citrusy. View from window of a major road, tram lines plus car park. Internet available in lobby for .20 cents a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn - at least you know what you're going to get”
Reviews.Author: GregoryJ
Reviews.Content: I often visit Berlin on business. The problem with unknown hotels in this city is that some of the times I land in unique hotels, while in other times, I wonder how the little basement I have been put in can be called a hotel. The thing about the Holiday Inn is that it's a safe betc for a risk averse guy like me. The price is always reasonable, and a 4 star Holiday Inn is a known worldwide standard so one should not be anxious all the way to the room. This Holiday Inn is in fact a great hotel in terms of room size and amenities. I had a really big room (non typical for Berlin) and it seems like it has recently been renovated, as the furniture and carpet in my room appeared very new. The bathroom was bright and clean, to my great satisfaction. Parking was free which is a big plus, while I had to pay for internet. I would recommend this hotel to holidaymakers and business travelers alike, as it is large enough to accommodate both families and business groups, and the tram across the road easily reaches the city in 10 minutes. I would not recommend it to those who want to be staying somewhere central though, as the hotel is at the East side of the city, and not in a vibrant, nor too friendly area.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Giantbubu
Reviews.Content: Perhaps a bit unfair to compare the hotels in Europe with those in Asia, but we didn't find this hotel worth recommending to others. Just your run-of-the-mill hotel room but without even a refrigerator or slippers for the room (the hotel book mentions you can request for those but they said 'not available'). They claimed to have upgrade our room to 'Executive Room' but come on... really not up to its name.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, location not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: h3h3
Reviews.Content: Well firstly, a tip, the best way to get to the hotel is to get the Number M5 or M6 tram from Hackescher Markt, which is fairly central. Get the tram northbound, in the direction of Zingster Straße or Eiesaer Straße. Get off the tram at Landsberger Allee, walk towards the Renault car place and you should be able to see the hotel's three towers rising above you. Now for the review: The first night, we had the misfortune to be a room nestled in between the rooms of an Italian school trip. Our entire floor as well as those above and below, the noise was ridiculous, shouting, screaming, smashed glasses, slamming doors. We complained at 8PM but we were told there where no spare rooms, but they'd move us again in the morning. We complained a further 3 times that night and finally got given a new room in the business building at 2am as well as 2 free breakfasts, which were pretty good. The hotel was clean, although our sheets and duvet weren't changed on the third night. The facilities are pretty basic, by no means 4 star, 3 star at best, but we had everything we needed, including a kettle in our newer room, TV with CNN and a bunch of German channels, shower room and the beds were very comfortable. All the extras are pretty extortionate, drinks from the vending machine are around 2 Euros, there is a small bottle of water in your room you'll be charged 3.50 for opening. The location isn't too bad, it's right in East Berlin, so it's got a kind of Eastern Bloc feeling to it, which I liked. Locally there is a cheap Markt for food (near the post office/renault car place) which will work out much cheaper than eating at the hotel. All in all, I'd probably stay again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good solution for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: radunkar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for one night stay - I was expecting a 4 star property and was little bit surprise on arrival - staff at the reception was nice, but not friendly, just handed over my room key, no information about hotel, service etc. When I have discovered that I left my toiletteries bag at home and asked them for cumb and other stuff, I was told to go down to pick it up... This is not a service you would expect from Holiday Inn standards. Breakfast quite expensive. Location OK, easily accessible by public transport, but hart to find for the first time - circa 5 minutes walk from tram station. Look for a three tower bulding on your left hand side. Good for one night stay.... but next time I choose other property.

Reviews.Title: “Good place-- but make sure you have your reservation print out.”
Reviews.Author: gordonoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great example of how a solid stay can collapse at the end.. the last impression being the lasting one-- and in this case poor. The hotel is well run, clean and so forth. Rooms were recently updated over the past several years and have been kept in good shape-- at least on the high third tower we stayed. Beds are comrfotable. Decor is reasonable. Housekeeping attentive. Common areas are well kept. Restaurant has a reasonably priced lunch special. The location is hard to reach withou specific Tram directions. Take subway to Landesberger Allee station then take one of two trams several more stops to within two long blocks of the hotel. We did not know thise however... despite calling the front dek... so if you're not certain of the Tram on day one-- grab a cab from the hotel directly across from the Landerberger Allee station. (Note: Good Internet Cafe located on North side across from Tram stop next to a very busy Gyro place.-- it's the only one in the area and will save you the very expensive Holiday Inn rate). The Tram service is very convenient once you lighten the load of bags. You're about 8 stops from Alexander Platz -- maybe 15 minutes in rush hour and you are very happy because you have a spacious clean room while other people are paying lots more money in cramped tiny rooms near there. Of course you are living in the East German area but who cares. You've got foresight becausee you purchased the best deal in town-- the 30 Euro 7 Day unadvertised on the flyer--you have to ask for it-- Subway/Tram/bus pass to all zones around Berlin. You zoom around town using Alexander Platz as your base and connecting to the Tram to go home. All because you read it on Trip Advisor right here. Ok-- so things are going well. The breakfast buffet is pricey but worth it a couple of days and you're eating with the locals in Alexander Platze the other days.. so who cares. The key to this hotel however is the rates. When you check in MAKE SURE YOU CONFIRM THE RATES WITH THE FRONT DESK. Otherwise, as happened to us.. THEY CHARGE THE RACK RATE REGARDLESS OF YOUR RESERVATION. IN FACT, THE SALES MANAGER FREELY ADMITS THAT THEY DO NOT HAVE AN INTERFACE WITH THE HOLIDAY INN ONLINE RESERVATION SYSTEM. So the approach this hotel has to put the ONUS ON YOU TO PROVE that you have the rates you say you have. This lead to quite a startling bill at the end of the stay-- nearly 300 Euros in over charges, denials from the front desk staff, the manager on duty and the sales manager that they had our original rates and a copy of the original reservation and meantime-- were' running to catch a flight. Not a problem. I whipped out my laptop and showed them the daily rates and-- to their credit-- they did revise the rates back. However the Sales Manager-- who I asked to look into why they didn't have the correct rates in the first place never returned any follow up e-mails or inquries as promised. So clearly this is the modus operandi of this hotel. SO MAKE SURE YOU REVIEW -- NOT WITH THE FRONT DESK STAFF BUT THE MANAGER ON DUTY-_ ANY ONLINE CONFIRMATIONS OF RATES BEFORE YOU START YOUR STAY. MAKE SURE YOU GET A TOP MANAGER"S INTIALS ON THE CHECK IN TO CONFIRM THE RATES AND THAT YOU RETAIN COPIES OF ALL YOUR ONLINE RESERVATIONS. Otherwise.. it will be rack rate for you. It really is unbelievable that the staff cannot soften itself to reach out to the public. The only thing worse then a staff that charges "any old rate" is the a staff that's in denial and disarray about what rates to charge-- then put's the onus on customers to produce in a big rush what rates there were. Plus it seems to be endorsed all the way up the management chain. It's time Holiday Inn Corporate took a look into this situation. And thus a 3-Plus star rating for the property and value falls to a 1-star on the basis of poor management of finances.

Reviews.Title: “Value over location”
Reviews.Author: Kenny-Lyle
Reviews.Content: As a frequent leisure visitor to Berlin I always look for value over location.This in part due to the wonderful public transport service that Berlin provides. The hotel is in the former East and as such does not have a S Bahn or U Bahn station within walking distance. There is however, a tram stop within 5 minutes walk with a service direct to Alexander Platz running every 5 minutes during the day. The hotel is a typical former East German concrete edifice with two wings and not the easiest on the eye.However, the rooms are large and reasonably up to date with flat screen tv and adequate air conditioning. Staff were pleasant enough and spoke fluent english. The main deficiency is the lack of any shops,restaurants and bars within the vicinity of the hotel. Not an issue really if you are fed and watered adequately on arrival. As with all ICT hotels I have stayed in , the breakfasts are inordinately overpriced however.15 Euros per person did seem vastly over charging taking into consideration the room rate of 50 Euros. Overall I would probably opt for one of the Express properties nearer the city centre next time. Small gripes I would say for a city that I still class as one of the most fascinating and enjoyable on the continent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: aw2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 3 day break to Berlin with my partner. The hotel can be a little hard to find if you dont know where you are going, but it is a 5 minute walk from the tram stop on Landsberger alle. The hotel itself is in some converted ex communist era Berlin concrete blocks, but dont let that put you off! Our room was on one of the highest floors and although there is not much to see, you do still get a view of Berlin (you can see Alexanderplatz and the TB Tower). The room was spacious, clean and amenities good. There is a German Bistro type restaurant on the ground floor, as well as an International restaurant. There are other facilities there although we did not try these. Myself and my partner were a little dubious when we arrived due to the location in the old East Berlin but we never had any problems whatsoever. The only point I would make is there is not alot near the hotel. There are no bars or restaurants other than those in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4-star, would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Bsinclair
Reviews.Content: Was my third time to Berlin, each time in a different hotel. I chose this one because it offered a good deal (3 nights for the price of 2 in a 4-star hotel) and because it seemed to be well located. Well, on both counts my choice was wrong. First, the hotel looks really ugly. Big (three towers), unpersonal, no room service, no air conditioning, poor choice in TV Channels, no shower products (just a gel for hands, body and hair....), and my room looked really gloomy. Things in favour of the room: it was clean, it had a fridge and some cutlery. But then I hadn't booked a studio, so it was quite useless. [NB: I cannot comment on the breakfast as I had chosen not to have it at the hotel. Indeed, it's normally quite easy to find nice bakeries in Berlin where to have breakfast for very low prices. However, it wasn't the case with this hotel as it is located in a residential area] As for the situation, the hotel is just close to the crossing of two big roads. As I were on the sixth floor, I wasn't too bothered by the noise, but I all the same had to sleep with the window closed. Regarding its location, it is in a "residential" area of East Berlin, that is, insereted between apartment towers, with no shops or restaurants close by. The surrounding are a bit gloomy (big bars of apartments) if you are there as a tourist. Well, at least it's relatively easily accessible with public transportation and you can reach a S-Bahn station in 10 minutes with the tram, which is by the way running all night. The hotel is relatively close to Friedrichshain and Prenzlauer Berg, two areas with lots of nice restaurants and places to go out. So what's the conclusion? Well, I expected better from a four-star in Berlin. During my last stays, I had been two 3-star hotels that were much more beautiful and well situated for comparable prices (the hotels were Agon Opera in December 2006 and Agon Frankfurter Allee in April 2007). In the end, I would not recommend this place unless you really just looking for a place to sleep. But then what's the point of booking in a 4-star?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: djpalmer32
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights. The hotel is situated about 20mins by tram from Alexanderplatz and is located in an area of apartment blocks. However, despite its location the hotel was clean, comfortable and well appointed. The staff were very friendly, especially as I had been ill on the car journey to Berlin, and I didn't look to great when we arrived! The restaurant was good, once you get used to Berliner cooking! Breakfast was very good with loads of choice.

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel...hot in an uncomfortable way”
Reviews.Author: forest77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with my partner. The room was spacious, bathroom clean and linen of good quality. On the day of our arrival there was an old sandwich in the minibar, so I guess it's not checked after each guest. I threw it in the bin and mentioned this when we checked out, the woman at the reception was sorry about my discovery and said that something like that should not happen. I agree but didn't let this ruin my holiday mood. During our stay the weather in Berlin was hot and so was the room (24h), as it did not have any air-conditioning. Furthermore, the drapes did not darken the room efficiently so it got quite light in the morning. The buffet breakfast was great, there was nothing missing and the empty plates were replaced efficiently. Checking in and out were done without much cordiality. The hotel is not situated as well as hotel info lets you to believe, but you can get around quite nicely with trams that stop close to the hotel. All in all, I might stay here again, but only at a cooler time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “A nice enough hotel, but off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: jackieb74
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine - not a 4 star though as indicated on the website we booked through! While the staff weren't rude, they weren't overly friendly - on arrival they just handed over our room key - didn't tell us where/when breakfast was, didn't even mention the fact that the hotel had a sauna! We only discovered this at the end of our stay! Slightly out of the way too, surrounded by car showrooms and not much else. Very handy to the tram line though - about 2/3 minutes walk - and this took us directly into Alexanderplatz. Trams run quite late into the night so it's fine getting back to the hotel after being in the city centre. If you're staying at this hotel you must eat at a little Italian restaurant just a short taxi ride away called Pizzeria Italiano (on the tramline to A'Platz)...great food and drink, lovely atmosphere, friendly staff and really cheap! (Less than 30euro for a meal for two)

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: roborant
Reviews.Content: This hotel lies in deep inside former east Berlin. It is quiet in the area without many activities around but that shouldn't stop you from staying here. The tram stops across the street from this three towered hotel. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. The staff jumps to every request. The restaurant has very good food and plenty of it. There is an Irish pub and a sports bar nearby for relaxing. The only downside is the location. Even though you can easily get there by using public transporation, I think most people would find it to be a little on the remote side. If you can get around that, then it's a good base station to tour around Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Berlin City East
HotelInfo.Address: Landsberger Allee 203, 13055 Berlin, Germany
